docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, the Government has been tinkering with the nation's pension system, largely in the name of two good causes: cutting the deficit and making retirement benefits more equitable. The cumulative effect of all the tinkering, however, has been anything but good, says a growing chorus of pension experts and economists. The changes, whose impact is only now being fully recognized, threaten the retirement benefits of many of the 41 million workers covered by traditional company-financed pension plans, they say. Because some changes are just kicking in and come into play over many years, baby boomers as well as those who have recently entered the labor force, the so-called Generation X, will be most affected.
